title: Britain's Got Talent: The Champions prize doubled by Simon Cowell
text:
Simon was generous (Picture: ITV/Getty/Rex)

Simon Cowell has graciously decided to double the prize money for the lucky Britain’s Got Talent: The Champion winner after learning that it was just £50,000.

The 59-year-old judge was shocked to learn about how much winners were given from hosts Ant McPartlin and Declan Donnelly and swiftly pledged to double it to £100,000 during a recording of the first show in the upcoming talent contest.

During filming, Simon had been listening to Ant host when he interjected: ‘Did you just say fifty grand? That’s it?’

According to reports, Ant replied: ‘That’s it. Unless you want to double it. Do you want to double it?’

The live audience cheered, prompting the music mogul to reply: ‘Yes, I will. It’s a hundred grand everybody,’ prompting more cheering.

Australian comedians The Nelson Twins, joked that winning the £50,000 would be a pretty big deal, given that they had ‘blown their life savings on a sandwich in Covent Garden.’

The judges are back with a bang (Picture: Rex Features)

Simon will join judges David Walliams, Amanda Holden and a heavily pregnant Alesha Dixon on the BGT spin-off series which will see the likes of 2011 winner Jai MacDowall return to the stage.

A source told The Sun that Susan Boyle, who had originally been slated for the show, was replaced by MacDowall due to her packed schedule.

‘They didn’t want to be short of contestants and SuBo was looking unlikely to confirm her appearance.

‘Jai was ecstatic and will be putting his heart into the show, in the hope of making it right to the end.’

Connie Talbot, one of the most adorable stars to come out of BGT, will also be making a comeback for The Champions.

The now 18-year-old, who first appeared on the show back in 2007, is reportedly giving herself another chance to win big.

Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions sees the most notorious acts from the past 12 years go head-to-head, following the success of America’s Got Talent: The Champions.

A rep from Simon Cowell’s entertainment company, Syco, told Metro.co.uk: ‘We only know Simon announced he was doubling the 50k to 100k during the show on Wednesday evening.

‘No official confirmation yet.’

Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions is expected to air later this year.
